definition: having an oblique or slanted direction, a punctuation mark (/) used to separate related items of information
details:
adjective
- having an oblique or slanted direction
= synonyms: aslant
- connecting two nonadjacent corners of a plane figure or any two corners of a solid that are not in the same face
= example: connecting two nonadjacent corners of a plane figure or any two corners of a solid that are not in the same face
noun
- a punctuation mark (/) used to separate related items of information
= synonyms: stroke
- (mathematics) a set of entries in a square matrix running diagonally either from the upper left to lower right entry or running from the upper right to lower left entry
- an oblique line of squares of the same color on a checkerboard
= example: an oblique line of squares of the same color on a checkerboard
- a line or cut across a fabric that is not at right angles to a side of the fabric
= synonyms: bias
- a straight line connecting any two vertices of a polygon that are not adjacent
= example: a straight line connecting any two vertices of a polygon that are not adjacent
